name: Slow Cooker Lengua (Beef Tongue)
author: liz
summary: Don't let the cut of meat scare you it is a very tender tasty meat. You will be pleasantly surprised. Find the meat at any Mexican market, ask the butcher. Serve this in tacos with chopped onion, tomato, cilantro, and wedges of lime.
ingredients: 2 cloves garlic, or more to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Place beef tongue, onion, garlic, and bay leaf in the crock of a slow cooker; generously season with salt
Pour in enough water to cover beef mixture
Transfer beef tongue to a work surface and cool slightly
Peel outer layer of skin from beef tongue and remove rough end
Chop the meat into bite-size pieces
Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat; cook and stir beef tongue meat until tender, 5 to 10 minutes
